title: Postdoc position in circuit and behavioural neuroscience
location: Jardin du Pharo 58, bd Charles Livon Marseille, France
field: Behavioural Science, Genetics, Neuroscience, Physiology, Virology,
job_description: RESEARCH FIELD(S)1Biology JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for a motivated, inquisitive, and adventurous postdoctoral fellow to join our recently established laboratory at the Mediterranean Institute of Neurobiology (INMED) in Marseille, France The focus of the lab is exploring the interactions between internal models and sensory information. Specifically, we study how long-range connections steer activity in the visual cortices using electrophysiology (Galloni et al. 2020), viral tracing, optogenetics (Galloni et al. 2021), in vivo recordings and behaviour The post is for 3 years and is funded by an A*Midex grant.  Neuroscience research in Marseille is broad, diverse, and therefore very fertile. INMED offers state-of-the-art research platforms and a collaborative scientific environment. The city of Marseille is a unique gem in the heart of the Mediterranean, culturally diverse and surrounded by magnificent nature.  QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS/EDUCATION & RESEARCH REQUIREMENTSThe ideal candidate should have a proven track record in developing behavioural tasks for head-fixed mice and/or experience with extracellular recordings in behaving animals. Affinity for developing open-source research equipment is an advantage.  APPLICATION DEADLINE              Until filled STARTING DATE As soon as possible  JOB LOCATIONMarseille, France REQUESTED DOCUMENTS OF APPLICATIONCV, short motivation letter, contact details of 2 referees  CONTACT TO APPLY ede.rancz@inserm.fr
